entry.title: New release for Pulse: v4.0.5 - UI & Compatibility Fixes
entry.content:
v4.0.5 - UI & Compatibility Fixes

Bug Fixes

  • Fixed version detection when installed via Proxmox community script
  • Restored orange highlighting for recently booted containers (< 1 hour uptime)
  • Fixed JSON parsing error when LXC containers have cpulimit set
  • Improved Proxmox VE 9 compatibility in temporary helper script

Installation

The official Proxmox community script now supports Pulse! Install with: bash bash -c "$(wget -qLO - https://github.com/community-scripts/ProxmoxVE/raw/main/ct/pulse.sh)"

Or use the manual installation: bash wget https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rcourtman/Pulse/main/install.sh chmod +x install.sh ./install.sh

Docker

bash docker run -d --name pulse \ -p 7655:7655 \ -v pulse-data:/etc/pulse \ rcourtman/pulse:latest

entry.title: New release for Pulse: v4.0.6 - Docker Persistence & Memory Reporting Fixes
entry.content:
Critical Fixes

This patch release fixes two important issues:

üêõ Bug Fixes

  1. Docker Persistence Fix (#253)
  2. Fixed config persistence in Docker where settings were being saved to /etc/pulse instead of the mounted /data directory

  3. Users mounting volumes to /data will now have their configurations properly persisted

  4. Windows VM Memory Reporting (#258)

  5. Fixed incorrect memory reporting for Windows VMs with balloon drivers
  6. Memory usage now correctly reflects actual usage within the balloon allocation

üì¶ Docker Usage

Docker images are now available! For Docker users, ensure you're mounting the data directory correctly: bash docker run -d --name pulse \ -p 7655:7655 \ -v pulse-data:/data \ rcourtman/pulse:v4.0.6

üîß Installation

Docker: bash docker pull rcourtman/pulse:v4.0.6

Binary Installation: Download the appropriate binary for your architecture from the release assets below.

See checksums.txt in release assets.

Currently only linux/amd64 Docker image is available. ARM builds are in progress.

entry.title: New release for Pulse: v4.0.7 - Docker Persistence Fix (Really Fixed)
entry.content:
Critical Docker Fix

This release fixes the Docker persistence issue that was not fully resolved in v4.0.6.

üêõ The Real Bug

v4.0.6 only partially fixed the Docker persistence issue. The ConfigHandlers were still calling config.SaveConfig() which used a global persistence instance potentially initialized with the wrong path. This release ensures handlers use their own correctly-initialized persistence instance.

üîß For Docker Users

If you're having persistence issues with Docker, this should finally fix it:

bash docker pull rcourtman/pulse:v4.0.7

Make sure your volume is mounted to /data: yaml volumes: - pulse_data:/data

üì¶ Installation

Docker: bash docker pull rcourtman/pulse:v4.0.7

Binary Installation: Download the appropriate binary for your architecture from the release assets.

üìù Checksums

See checksums.txt in release assets.

üôè Thanks

Thanks to @raregtp for testing and reporting that v4.0.6 didn't fix the issue.

entry.title: New release for Pulse: v4.0.9
entry.content:
Critical Bug Fixes

Fixed

  • LXC cpulimit parsing (#256) - Fixed JSON parsing error when LXC containers have cpulimit set
  • PBS connection errors (#260) - Improved error handling and fixed port configuration for PBS connections
  • Cluster "no healthy nodes" error (#257) - Added better endpoint validation and fallback for cluster configurations

Technical Details

  • Added float support to FlexInt type for parsing cpulimit values
  • Improved PBS error messages to detect HTML responses
  • Fixed PBS default port handling (8007)
  • Added cluster endpoint validation and single-node fallback
  • Enhanced error logging for debugging cluster issues
